body_html:
@girving Yep, I think you're right:

In [163]: tf.pack(x, 4).eval().shape
Out[163]: (2, 3, 4, 5, 10)

In [164]: tf.pack(x, -1).eval().shape
Out[164]: (2, 3, 4, 5, 10)

In [165]: tf.pack(x, -1)
Out[165]: <tf.Tensor 'pack_105:0' shape=(2, 3, 4, 10, 5) dtype=float64>

And indeed, trying to eval the first result from the pack/unpack combination at the end of my snippet raises a shape mismatch error.

body:
@girving Yep, I think you're right:

``` python
In [163]: tf.pack(x, 4).eval().shape
Out[163]: (2, 3, 4, 5, 10)

In [164]: tf.pack(x, -1).eval().shape
Out[164]: (2, 3, 4, 5, 10)

In [165]: tf.pack(x, -1)
Out[165]: <tf.Tensor 'pack_105:0' shape=(2, 3, 4, 10, 5) dtype=float64>
```

And indeed, trying to `eval` the first result from the pack/unpack combination at the end of my snippet raises a shape mismatch  error.
